WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
When debugging, the debugger steps into all loaded js files which is a pain when landing into JQuery code for example.

It would be great to be able to specify on the reference line that the js file associated with the definition file should be bypassed during debugging. 

/// <reference path="TypeFiles/jquery.d.ts" debug="no" />

Of course, the definition file should contain information so that the debugger could reliably identify the js source file.
WorkItem.Summary: Optional Visual Studio Debugger bypass  of referenced scripts like JQuery

Comments.Message: There are a few ways we can do this, and we might want the ultimate solution to be VS-specific since the debugging we're trying to change wouldn't be general to our source map support
